channel.title: Jacob's 2022 Midterm Elections Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Jacob's 2022 Midterm Elections Blog

item.title: Blog Post 2: Economic Indicators
item.description: This week I’ll be looking at some economic indicators to see if they hold any predictive power over past midterm elections. cd114 <- st_read("../data/districtShapes/districts114.shp", quiet = TRUE) # Select Oregon cd114_or <- cd114 %>% filter(STATENAME == "Oregon") %>% mutate(DISTRICT = as.character(DISTRICT)) %>% select(DISTRICT) or <- ggplot() + geom_sf(data = cd114_or, aes(fill = "blue"), alpha = 0.9) + theme_void() ggplotly(or) %>% layout(xaxis = list(showline = FALSE), yaxis = list(showline = FALSE))

item.title: Blog Post 1: Exploring Past House Vote and Seat Share
item.description: This blog post will be the first in a series of posts for Gov 1347: Election Analytics, a course at Harvard taught by Ryan Enos. Over the course of this semester, I will be building up my electoral knowledge in order to build a predictive model of the upcoming 2022 midterm elections. Vote Share and Seat Share by State in the 2020 House Election Let’s attempt to visualize past House election data to get a better sense of the past political landscape and warm up my incredibly rusty R skills.
